titleStmt.title: John W. O'Neal to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG2272

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
J. B. CONKLIN.
ATTORNEY AT LAW.
LIEUT. A. H. NASMYTH,
Late of 47th O. V. I., Chief Clerk.

U. S. Authorized Claim Agency,
No. 4 West Third Street.

Cincinnati, Nov 22 1865
MHon Gov Bramllett
Sir,

I have been solicited by numerous pensioners in My county Kenton Co. Ky to get appointed a Notary Public = as it is very inconvenient for pensions to go to a justice of the Pleace & then to Independence to get the seal of the clerk of the court & as a Notary is recognized with only his seal of office it would accomodate many persons
If you have no objection & will Send me the form of bond &c I will make the application=

I remain very respectfully
Your obt sert
John. W. Oneal
Address morning view Kenton County -- Ky=

We have Known Mr Jno W. Oneal for about three years & find him honest & trustworthy & we think competent for any business which would come in his way of the kind more so than a majority of Justices of the Peace who sometimes mangle things up terribly = We have been solicited by several to have him appointed & he is himself very indifferent about it = Says it will be no profit to him but if he is appointed will do the best he can to assist such persons=

Hoping to hear a favorable answer from you, we remain very
Respectfully
Your obt sert
Conklin Bros & Co

Notary Public
Kenton Co
John W. Oneal
apptd
30th Nov 1865
